text: how many people spend 75% of their
working time on their top three goals
please raise your
hand Okay we only have three
people How many people spend over 50% of
their time on their top three goals now
we're up to seven
This is the striking
thing In almost every survey that has
been taken 80 to 90% of the people spend
less than 50% of their working time on
what they say are their top goals So
that's an incredible statistic when you
think about it What it shows is that
most people are passive in the way they
approach the work week They are
responding to emails phones meetings
other people's goals And they come home
at night and they say "I've worked so
hard but actually what have I
accomplished i've accomplished other
people's goals I haven't accomplished my
goals." So those are the basic facts Now
I want to make two other ideas here One
is if you want to accomplish your top
goals you've got to figure out a way to
get the small stuff quickly done So how
do we do
that well the first is my acronym called
Ohio Only handle it once This has
nothing to do with a football team or
the Buckeyes or anything like that but
it applies primarily to emails Now we
all get too many emails Some of us get a
hundred emails some of us get 200 emails
some of us get 300 emails If all you do
is respond to your emails you will do
nothing else that day but respond to
your emails So this is what Ohio is
about It's a two-part idea The first is
you should work at the goal of throwing
away immediately just reading the
subject line 70 to 80% of your emails I
mean think about it there's some from
some politician who's soliciting you yet
again for a contribution from some
nonprofit charity that you know nothing
about that wants it or it's something
from your employer that's being sent out
people I mean the fact is there is
something like 70 or 80% of the emails
that are not worth responding to But the
other 20 or 30% and this is the key you
have to respond to
immediately A lot of people tell me well
they think it's important they put it in
some sort of holding box and at the end
of the week they have 300 emails in that
holding box Then when they go the next
week to find it it takes them an hour
just to find the one that they wanted
And of course the person who sent it was
important and so they don't like to get
it a response a week from now So that's
a basic idea Ohio And I know it's
popular because my publisher every time
I go there all the people in the office
say "I've gotten somewhere efficient I'm
doing Ohio."
Now two of the things that keep people
from being efficient are perfectionism
and uh procrastination How many
perfectionists do we have in the
audience please raise your hand
Okay So how did you become a
perfectionist
i don't know how it happened You don't
know how it happened Who are the other
perfectionists how do you think it
happened miss being the middle kids It's
the only way I could be recognized Oh a
middle kid It's a psychological problem
By the way I'm a middle child too And
I'm not a perfectionist Yes Virgo You're
a Virgo It came out of the
astrology Who else yes Who went to
parochial school here and claims that it
was a nun who did it
so we have a number of people who are
perfectionists Now like most things
there is a time to be a perfectionist If
you're doing something really important
like flying that plane you better get it
right If you're sending a wire for a few
million dollars you ought to get it
right But there are lots of things in
our life that aren't very important For
instance how many of us have to fill out
monthly status reports of what we're
doing in the business no one actually
reads them or they read the first
paragraph But some people just keep
going you know they want the grammar to
be right They send five pages No one is
caring
So the key to perfection is do A work
for your top priorities and do B or C
work for things that aren't that
priority Do it quick and dirty And
that's an important thing
A second idea is a boring breakfast Now
let me say this is just an example In my
book I discuss how I am really not
interested in breakfast It just doesn't
excite me at all I have the same
breakfast every day Cheerios a banana
and skim

some people from Longwood here can
remember the time when we had

sort of food
bananas So we bought six
bananas At night he says it's not enough
I eat 12 bananas a day
In fact that is the key to my tennis
game That potassium
helps build back my
muscles So I figured what the
hell i ate one a day maybe I'd get a
little better you know but I warn you if
you eat 3 or 4 in the morning your

probably not a good idea But I noticed
that President Obama does the same thing
He apparently doesn't care exactly how
he dresses He has five winter suits and
five summer suits His five winter suits
are all blue They're the same exact
suit He just doesn't spend any time on
it He's got so many other things to do
He doesn't spend any time on it Uh some
